result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Deford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for David J Deford
Current: 1135 S Mason Street, Appleton, WI 54914 United States  (Effective: 01-06-2016)
Prior: 395 1/2 S Main Street, Iola, WI 54945 United States

Defendant David J Deford in court with attorney Richard E. Bender. Intern Taylor Krause under the supervision of David R. Knaapen appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Bender agrees the defendant qualifies as a repeat offender. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Intern Kraus makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Bender makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
40 days jail. 
Huber for employment and any counseling or medical appointments. 
Can be served in Portage or Waupaca Counties. 
Sentence to commence forthwith. 
Remanded to custody of the Sheriff's department. 
Pay costs. 

Court questions defendant re: sentence commencement. 
Atty Bender indicates he is ready to serve today.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on May 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David J Deford in court with attorney Karen Lueschow. Defendant David J Deford in CUSTODY. David Raymond Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:15 p.m.  Court calls case. 
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.

Not Guilty Plea entered.
